content.question: Two conducting plates hold equal and opposite charges that create an electric field of magnitude <math alttext="E equals 95 newtons per coulomb " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>95</mn><mrow><mrow><mtext> N</mtext></mrow><mo>/</mo><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> that is directed to the right, as shown in the figure above. Points <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are <math alttext="0.75 centimeter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.75</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> apart with <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> closer to the positive plate. A proton is released from rest at point <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the kinetic energy of the proton when it reaches point <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="positive 1.14 times 10 to the power negative 19 joules " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>1.14</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="positive 1.52 times 10 to the power negative 17 joules " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>1.52</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>17</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="positive 1.92 times 10 to the negative 7 joules" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>1.92</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="positive 1.14 times 10 to the power negative 19 joules " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>1.14</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
